title: XGBoosting (RR)
description: A generic windowed forecasting method using XGBoost regression (requested by RollsRoyce). The forecasting error is used as anomaly score.

parameters.name: train_window_size
parameters.description: Size of the training windows. Always predicts a single point!

parameters.name: n_estimators
parameters.description: Number of gradient boosted trees. Equivalent to number of boosting rounds.

parameters.name: tree_method
parameters.description: Tree method to use. Default to auto. If this parameter is set to default, XGBoost will choose the most conservative option available. `exact` is slowest, `hist` is fastest. Prefer `hist` and `approx` over `exact`, because for most datasets they have comparative quality, but are significantly faster.

parameters.name: n_trees
parameters.description: If >1, then boosting random forests with `n_trees` trees.

parameters.name: max_depth
parameters.description: Maximum tree depth for base learners.

parameters.name: max_samples
parameters.description: Subsample ratio of the training instance.

parameters.name: colsample_bytree
parameters.description: Subsample ratio of columns when constructing each tree.

parameters.name: colsample_bylevel
parameters.description: Subsample ratio of columns for each level.

parameters.name: colsample_bynode
parameters.description: Subsample ratio of columns for each split.

parameters.name: random_state
parameters.description: Seeds the randomness of the bootstrapping and the sampling of the features.

parameters.name: n_jobs
parameters.description: The number of jobs to run in parallel. `-1` means using all processors.

parameters.name: random_state
parameters.description: Seeds the randomness of the bootstrapping and the sampling of the features.
